pageProps.title: natural vs formal language is a false dichotomy and accrues unwanted connotations

children.value: "Natural" here is meant to denote (at least according to Clark) "social" and "strategic" and "Schelling point built". "formal" is meant to denote "precise". Looks like a case of lifting a disambiguation into a type that accrues unwanted connotations: "natural" ought not be taken for "imprecise", nor ought "formal" to imply "apurposive" or "asocial".
Aside: is there a linguistics term for when a distinction is lifted into a definition?
